page.title: 01ACHNAIRN BY LOCH SHIN
page.content: This block is dominated by Loch Shin and by an area of rough common grazing with some small Forestry Commission coniferous plantations, rising gently from the Lochside. There are only a few houses, predominantly in square 12 (Achnairn) and squares 2/3 (Shinness Lodge). There is one main road passing through the block from Lairg to Scourie on the west coast and one minor road,, but apart from these, only tracks. The majority of the population have at least some crofting interests keeping sheep and cattle, growing potatoes and making hay for winter feed. However, many supplement their incomes through bed and breakfast ir renting out houses in the summer to tourists and there is also a camping and caravan site in square 12. These supplementary sources of income and other employment opportunities
